law.catch_line: Denial, because of sex, of equal enjoyment of restaurants, hotels, motels or facilities supported by government funds prohibited.

text.section: It shall be an unlawful practice to deny an individual, because of sex, the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, privileges, advantages, and accommodations of a restaurant, hotel, motel, or any facility supported directly or indirectly by government funds.

law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 155, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 104, sec. 6.
